fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = (X \otimes 1 ) \otimes Y, sw = X \otimes Y, se = X \otimes Y, ne = X \otimes ( 1 \otimes Y), east = X \otimes \lambda _{ Y } , west = \rho _{ X } \otimes Y, north = \alpha _{{ X },{ 1 },{ Y }} , south/style = {equal}, height = 1.5cm, width = 3.5cm, }

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A monoidal category consists of the following data.

fr:ul.fr:li: A functor { \otimes }:{ \mathsf { C } \times \mathsf { C } } \to { \mathsf { C } } called the monoidal product.
An object 1 \in \mathsf { C } called the monoidal unit.
A natural isomorphism { \alpha _{{ X },{ Y },{ Z }} }:{ (X \otimes Y) \otimes Z } \to { X \otimes (Y \otimes Z) } called the associator.
A natural isomorphism { \lambda _{ X } }:{ 1 \otimes X } \to { X } called the left unitor.
A natural isomorphism { \rho _{ X } }:{ X \otimes 1 } \to { X } called the right unitor.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: These data are subject to the following axioms.

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = (X \otimes 1 ) \otimes Y, sw = X \otimes Y, se = X \otimes Y, ne = X \otimes ( 1 \otimes Y), east = X \otimes \lambda _{ Y } , west = \rho _{ X } \otimes Y, north = \alpha _{{ X },{ 1 },{ Y }} , south/style = {equal}, height = 1.5cm, width = 3.5cm, }
